Yes, the answer is 100. BECAUSE: A series of arrows are drawn to depict the motion of each ball. These arrows suggest:
The ball labeled A (the red ball) is moving.
The arrow on its right is pointing out of the box. This means that ball A is being moved by an external force (an arrow).
If ball A was the only ball in the box, it would have passed through the arrow's point of departure (a pink gate on the left) and continued in a straight line.
